channel.title: Documentation for Version 1.0 (Latest) on Boston Region STOPS Model
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation for Version 1.0 (Latest) on Boston Region STOPS Model

item.title: 1. Introduction
item.description: This document provides user guidance for the Boston Regional STOPS model (2024 version), which was developed for the Boston Region Metropolitan Planning Organization (MPO) using STOPS version 2.53.

item.title: 2. Model Configuration
item.description: This chapter describes the specific configuration of the Boston Regional STOPS model, which was developed and calibrated using STOPS version 2.53.

item.title: 3. Model Inputs
item.description:
This chapter describes the sources of the key input data used to develop the Boston Regional STOPS Model.

Analysis Years

The model is configured for several analysis years to support both short-term and long-range planning:

item.title: 4. Model Calibration & Outputs
item.description:
This chapter describes the adjustments made to calibrate the model to observed conditions and summarizes the final STOPS estimates.

Calibration Adjustments

To calibrate the model to local conditions, several adjustments were made to STOPS parameters and input files, including:

item.title: 5. Running the Model
item.description: This guide outlines the steps for executing an initial run of the Boston Regional STOPS model, based on the official STOPS User Guide.

item.title: 6. Example Application & Forecasts
item.description: This chapter presents a test application of the Boston Regional STOPS model for a corridor and provides horizon year forecasts.

item.title: 7. Documents
item.description:
This section provides links to supporting model documents.

  • Boston Regional STOPS User Guide.pdf : Guideline for user run of the Boston Region STOPS.
  • Boston Region STOPS Model Development Report.pdf : Development report provides data and configurations details.
  • Boston Region STOPS User Agreement.pdf

To receive a copy of the Boston Region STOPS Model, please complete the following user agreement and email model.support@ctps.org
